basic.description: This course serves to acquaint students with the U.S. Intelligence community, the processes and platforms for information/data gathering and analysis and how the subsequent "intelligence" is used by policy/decision-makers. Throughout the course students are given opportunities to gather, analyze and report their findings to case-studies and then compare their conclusions to real-world outcomes.
basic.subject: PAD
basic.title: Seminar in Public Administration: Selected Topics
